The following is the fixed sequence that is used for pilot symbols in the meta-training dataset 𝒟𝒟\mathcal{D} and meta-test dataset 𝒟Tsubscript𝒟T\mathcal{D}_{\text{T}} in the offline scenario  for 16-QAM: −3−3​j,−3+1​j,1+1​j,1−3​j,−3+3​j,3+1​j,1−1​j,−1−3​j,3+3​j,3−1​j,−1−1​j,−1+3​j,3−3​j,−3−1​j,−1+1​j,1+3​j,−3−3​j,−3+1​j,…33𝑗31𝑗11𝑗13𝑗33𝑗31𝑗11𝑗13𝑗33𝑗31𝑗11𝑗13𝑗33𝑗31𝑗11𝑗13𝑗33𝑗31𝑗…-3-3j,-3+1j,1+1j,1-3j,-3+3j,3+1j,1-1j,-1-3j,3+3j,3-1j,-1-1j,-1+3j,3-3j,-3-1j,-1+1j,1+3j,-3-3j,-3+1j,\ldots.
Pilots in meta-test dataset 𝒟Tsubscript𝒟T\mathcal{D}_{\text{T}} and training set 𝒟ktrsuperscriptsubscript𝒟𝑘tr\mathcal{D}_{k}^{\text{tr}} follow this same fixed sequence. For the experiments in Sec. V-B,
every  demodulator (4) except for CAVIA is a neural network with L=5𝐿5L=5 layers, i.e., an input layer with 222 neurons, three hidden layer s with 10,30,3010303010,30,30  neurons, and a softmax output layer with 161616 neurons. For CAVIA, we use a neural network with an input layer of 121212 neurons, three hidden layer s with 10,30,3010303010,30,30  neurons, and a softmax output layer with 161616 neurons, so that the dimension of the context parameter ϕitalic-ϕ\phi is 10. For the activation function, we adopt a  ReLU function as σ​(⋅)=ReLU​(⋅)𝜎⋅ReLU⋅\sigma(\cdot)=\text{ReLU}(\cdot).  Detailed settings are described in Table I.

We trained the demodulator (4)  with the same architecture
with same mini-batch sizes and learning rates described above for offline meta-learning.  For this experiment, we set 𝒟kte=𝒟ksuperscriptsubscript𝒟𝑘tesubscript𝒟𝑘\mathcal{D}_{k}^{\text{te}}=\mathcal{D}_{k}. Other details are described in Table I.
